creator: dnimonsjunk@swbell.net
text:
I uninstalled Apache because of some problems and now I can't install it again. Is there any other 
steps you have to take besides uninstalling it and deleting the folder where Apache is stored?
What (exact) error message(s) do you get when you attempt to reinstall it?
creator: wrowe@apache.org
dnimonsjunk@swbell.net
text: there is no error message. it does not show the apache service in the apache monitor.

Please refer to the cited incident.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14383 ***
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
Sorry I cannot see how this bug could be a duplicate of 
14383 Copy task with filtering broken GIF files (On Ant Core 1.5.1). A short
explanation would be nice (either here or in bug report 14383).
creator: jkf@apache.org

text: i don't want a problem about gifs
creator: dnimonsjunk@swbell.net

text: there was an error message that said that port 80 was still being used.
creator: dnimonsjunk@swbell.net

text:
Sorry, fat fingers, I had dupped your report against the wrong incident,
  you want bug 14382 to explain how to recover.

  You can't be running a server when you install Apache.  Strongly suggest
  you consult an appropriate users list if you don't know how to stop another
  service using port 80.  The bugs database is only for reporting bugs in the
  Apache software, not for user configuration and troubleshooting.

  I will look at making the installer fail more cleanly or prompt for an
  alternate port number if 80 is in use.  Thank you for the report.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14382 ***
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: ok thank's for your help! (not). i've had enough and am switching to iis
creator: dnimonsjunk@swbell.net
